title: (x) Faceted OCR-type font w/ serifs - CAD Beta {Angel}
content:
I’ve searched high and low for this font that appeared on the AA Publications book “Morphogenesis of Flux Structure” book by Mutsuro Sasaki.

It’s similar to Chunkfeeder or United faces, but particularly different “G” and “R.” It may or may not be monospaced.

You can see the whole specimen here:  
 [http://www.aaschool.info/publications/images/sasaki\_book\_cover.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211505/http:/www.aaschool.info/publications/images/sasaki_book_cover.jpg "http://www.aaschool.info/publications/images/sasaki\_book\_cover.jpg")

But here’s a snippet of it:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211505im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sasaki_book_cover_4925.jpg)

Any ideas?

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ (x) Basic square "Rockstar Games" - custom drawn {Ray Larabie}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211505/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36369 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) The University Press of Kentucky logo, like Trajan inline - Augustea Open {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211505/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36537 "Go to next forum topic")
author: thebish

comments.content: It’s called [CAD Beta](http://web.archive.org/web/20080327211505/http:/aalog.net/?p=2302). I couldn’t find it anywhere else so it’s probably a custom design for the AA.
Nice work, thanks for clearing that up. It must be a custom design b/c I couldn’t find it either.
